intro: Matelea angustiloba, commonly known as the narrowleaf matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it has a woody stem that becomes more prominent with age.
